author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Adam Smith (D-Wash.) said on Sunday he doesn’t think capturing Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro will have a significant impact on the scope of drug trafficking in the United States. “No, I don't,” Smith, the top Democrat on the House Armed Services Committee, said in an interview on NewsNation’s “The Hill,” when asked if he...
title: Smith on Maduro capture: 'I don't think it fundamentally changed drug trafficking in America at all'

author: Max Rego
description: Democratic Rep. Ami Bera (Calif.) said Sunday that the Trump administration’s motives for capturing Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro goes beyond stopping the flow of drugs and sanctioned oil from the South American country. “I do think part of the intent of the administration is now that they have a different administration in Venezuela that they...
title: House Democrat: 'Part of the intent' of Maduro ouster is to send Venezuelans back

author: Emily Brooks
description: The House will return from a holiday break to face sagas that have vexed the chamber for months. Debates on health care and attempts to revive expired ObamaCare subsidies will stretch into January and the first quarter of the year. An end-of-month funding deadline poses a threat of a partial government shutdown. And the Department...
title: Epstein, health care and a shutdown fight: Here's what the House faces in January

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Sunday that the U.S. military activity in Venezuela this weekend did not require congressional approval because it was a law enforcement operation, not a prolonged invasion of a foreign country. In an interview on ABC News’s “This Week,” Rubio defended the operation against claims that it was illegal....
title: Rubio: Venezuela strikes 'a law enforcement operation,' not 'invasion'

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Jim Himes (D-Conn.), the ranking member on the House Intelligence Committee, on Sunday labeled the recent U.S. operation in Venezuela an “imperial adventure.” “Look, this is a long pattern and a particularly egregious example of a pattern of this administration not giving a hoot about the United States Congress, which, by the way, Jim...
title: Top House Intelligence Democrat labels Venezuela operation 'imperial adventure'

author: Addy Bink
description: If you purchased any of the more than 280 cut types, you may qualify for a payment.
title: Buy any of these beef cuts between 2014 and 2019? You may qualify for payment in $87.5M settlement

author: Max Rego
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Sunday that multiple U.S. agencies, including the State Department, Pentagon and Department of Justice (DOJ) will be involved in running Venezuela for the time being.  “This is a team effort by the entire national security apparatus of our country. But it is running this policy. And the goal of...
title: Rubio says US 'running' Venezuela via 'team effort'

author: Tara Suter
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Sunday that the U.S.’s recent action in Venezuela was not similar to American actions in the Middle East, despite some recent comparisons. “I still think that a lot of people analyze everything that happens in foreign policy through the lens of what happened from 2001 to 2000 — you...
title: Rubio on Venezuela action: ‘This is not the Middle East’

author: Al Weaver
description: The Senate is staring down multiple flash points in the coming months as lawmakers head into a year colored by electoral politics but with plenty of policy fights on the horizon. Lawmakers wrapped up a grueling year by completing some of their pre-holiday agenda, including passing the annual National Defense Authorization Act and confirming scores...
title: Health care, funding and more: 5 things to watch when the Senate returns

author: Eliot Wilson, opinion contributor
description: Israel has recognized Somaliland as an independent nation, prompting criticism from some countries and an emergency meeting of the Security Council, while Somaliland has made significant progress in terms of democracy, economy, and security over the past 30 years.
title: Somaliland is a functioning state. Treat it that way.

author: Max Rego
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio believes it is too early to discuss holding elections in Venezuela. “All of that, I think, is premature at this point. There’s a lot of work to be done here,” Rubio told host Kristen Welker on NBC’s “Meet the Press.” After U.S. forces captured Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his...
title: Rubio: Talks about Venezuelan elections 'premature'

author: Addy Bink
description: Have you been longing to go for a Target run, only to have no Target to run to? That could be changing soon.
title: Target is expanding: Here's where new stores are expected

description: Overly restrictive zoning, cautious lending and anti-development politics created a long freeze in housing production.
title: Don’t let this housing crisis go to waste

author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. Tom Cotton (R-Ark.) said Sunday that any new leadership in Venezuela would be required "to meet our demands” after the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.  “When the president said the United States is going to be running Venezuela, it means that the new leaders of Venezuela need to meet our demands,” Cotton told...
title: Cotton: New Venezuela leaders 'need to meet our demands'

author: Alix Martichoux
description: The Trump administration announced all parks will be offering free admission to U.S. residents on President Donald Trump's birthday, but five other formerly free days are being dropped.
title: No more free entry: National parks reinstating fees on these days in 2026

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump's operation to oust Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro on Saturday drew a sharp response in the U.S. and abroad, from outright praise to fury, with some expressing gladness over the end of a dictator's regime tempered by concern over how it was handled. The massive covert operation, in the works since late summer, followed...
title: Live updates: Trump operation against Maduro draws praise, fury

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) is escalating the Trump administration's attacks on Minnesota by freezing all federal funding to the state's childcare providers.  Day care operators and advocates have few answers about how the sudden stoppage will impact their communities. They said the restriction is putting providers at risk of closure and...
title: HHS escalates Minnesota fraud fight, prompting fear among daycare providers

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: Surprise U.S. strikes on Venezuela and the capture of that country’s president, Nicolás Maduro, are putting the crescendo on a combative first year at the Pentagon for Secretary Pete Hegseth. Hegseth, who with President Trump rechristened the Department of Defense as the Department of War, has sought to restore a “warrior ethos” to the military,...
title: Maduro capture adds to Hegseth’s combative first year at the Pentagon

description: The Green Fee increases the Transient Accommodations Tax by .75% to an 11% rate statewide.
title: Hawaii's 'Green Fee' is in effect, but not all  of it: What does that mean?

description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is now on U.S. soil after the Trump administration captured and removed him from power. Maduro, whom the U.S. government views as an illegitimate leader, and his wife were taken to New York to face...
title: Who are the key Venezuelan political players after Maduro's capture
